comments: I thought he was a good prof! Tried to relate to the students and was pretty funny at times. Taught clearly and didn\'t do any "trick questions" on the exam. Is a newbie, but definitely not incompetent.

He was Brand new! but notes came straight out of the text. when he got to somthing he liked you could see a difference in his teaching. Great potential, he was just really scared! ya I thought he was HOT haha *(much better then my Psych 104 prof as far as exams go)*

First time prof, but you can tell that he puts a lot of effort in preparing lectures, and I\'m sure in a few years he wouldn\'t be reading off his lecture notes. Lots of work with him, since his notes don\'t follow the textbook, yet you\'re still expected to know both very well for exams. Clarifies course content, so pretty good for a first year prof

Exams are easy if you study enough; everything (except for maybe 1 question/exam) is out of his notes and the textbook. Simply read off and added some side comments to his powerpoint slides, but it wasn\'t too boring; I managed to stay awake even though I fell asleep in my other classes. Explanations are for the most part clear, understandable.

He was funny! Yeah he just reads off his notes, I think he could be a decent prof he just has to do his homework and do more preparation before lecturing! His exams were difficult considering its 1st year, and the class wasnt supposed to be curved, but I think he curved it in the end, or I would not have ended up with a B+ after getting 60 on final

He is a terrible prof. His notes are scripted, his exams are too difficult for the level that he is teaching at, he focuses too much on his interests and not the subject matter. Brings in a lot of guest speakers for things he \'didn\'t know so well\'. There were a lot of them. Lied to us on a midterm. Do NOT take his class.

If psychology had a story time component, Joseph would a great prof, he is excellent at reading and is great at pointing out charts and graphs. In reality, he is a terrible prof that does not engage his students and simply read from a script which isn\'t always the same as the provided notes. Avoid if possible, if not read the textbook religiously.

Pretty much straight out of the textbook...prof\'s lectures were incredibly scripted and exam questions were vague at best. First time prof as other people have stated but I personally don\'t harbor any hopes that he\'ll get much better. If you enjoy reading the text and skipping class go right ahead.

not the worst prof ever.....his first time teaching though so im sure if he taught again hed be better. yeah he totally relies on scripted notes that he reads way too much. i like that he doesn\'t agree with the curve, however the mark cutoffs should be lower/easier midterms if this is the case! (our average was 60-something...)

First time ever teaching a class, so I won\'t be too hard on him, but still, he is not the greatest. He has potential, I think, if he would learn to stop directly reading off his notes and just teach! I guess he atleast tries to make things interesting, and doesn\'t agree with the curve which is nice.

Hayes is not engaging and this is his first time teaching. Appears as though his lectures are scripted. Notes are available in full powerpoint format and his lecture deviates very little from these. Low incentive to attend class. First exam was easy, but must read the text.

class is boring. just read the textbook b/c everything he teaches is the same from there. his notes are not very helpful. explanations are unclear at times. i\'m sure he\'s a great guy but maybe he shouldn\'t teach...
Boring and uninspired. Poor teaching skills and shows no incentive to become any better. Avoid his class if you can. No PhD as of Winter Term 2009.
